overview: The purpose of this Act is to establish a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the second and fifth circuits and to require the third circuit of the judiciary and big island drug court to conduct an interim study to establish a blueprint for a women's court pilot program in the third circuit. [3] The pilot program shall implement trauma-informed and evidence-based practices with the goal of diverting participants from incarceration, supporting their success in the community, and reducing recidivism. [3] The judiciary is required to submit annual reports, and the Act shall be repealed on June 30, 2028. [3] [3]
appropriations: There is an unspecified appropriation out of the general revenues for fiscal years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027 to the Judiciary for equipment, services, and temporary positions. [3] [3] The measure also includes an unspecified appropriation to the department of health for the pilot program and the establishment of temporary positions for the same fiscal years. [3] The Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs respectfully requests the Committee on Finance to consider an appropriation amount of $801,802 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) to the Department of Health, which would include $145,000 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) for a temporary clinical psychologist, $76,788 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) for a temporary social worker, and $45,216 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) for a temporary social services assistant V. [4] [4]
assumptions_and_methodology: The Department of Health requests a budget of $801,802 (HB727_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt), which is based on the Department’s staffing requirements for the operation of the existing Women’s Court pilot project of the First Circuit. [2] The testimony specifies that each circuit would require a 1.0 FTE Clinical Psychologist at a cost of [$145,000 (HB727_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt)], a 1.0 FTE Social Worker/Human Services Professional IV at [$76,788 (HB727_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt)], and a 1.0 FTE Social Services Assistant V at [$45,216 (HB727_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt)]. [2] The Judiciary notes that circumstances on the neighbor islands may warrant different implementation and different resource requirements. [2]
agency_impact: A women's court pilot program shall be established within the second and fifth circuits of the judiciary. [3] The third circuit of the judiciary and big island drug court shall conduct an interim study to establish a blueprint for a women's court pilot program in the third circuit. [3] An appropriation is inserted for the Department of Health for the women's court pilot program, including the establishment of positions. [4]
economic_impact: The goal of the program is diverting participants from incarceration, supporting their success in the community, and reducing recidivism. [3] Research reflects that for women, histories of abuse, trauma, poverty, mental illness, substance use disorders, and unhealthy relationships intersect with their entry into criminal behavior. [3] As of August, 2024, twenty-three women are currently participating in the program in the first circuit. [3]
policy_impact: This measure amends the original bill by deleting language that would have established a three-year women's court pilot program in the Third Circuit of the Judiciary. [4] Instead, it requires the Third Circuit of the Judiciary and Big Island Drug Court to study and submit a report on establishing a women's court pilot program in the Third Circuit. [4] The amended bill establishes a temporary three-year women's court pilot program within the Second and Fifth Circuits. [3]
revenue_sources: There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii an unspecified sum for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum for fiscal year 2026-2027. [3] The sums appropriated shall be expended by the judiciary for the purposes of this Act. [3] A separate appropriation from general revenues shall be expended by the department of health for the purposes of this Act. [3]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The Act establishes a three-year women's court pilot program in the second and fifth circuits. [3] It appropriates an unspecified amount from general revenues for fiscal year 2025-2026 and fiscal year 2026-2027 to the Judiciary and Department of Health. [3] [3] The Committee on Finance is requested to consider an appropriation of $801,802 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) to the Department of Health. [4] The DOH budget request is based on staffing requirements for the existing First Circuit pilot project. [2] For each circuit, the DOH requires a 1.0 FTE Clinical Psychologist at $145,000 (HB727_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt), a 1.0 FTE Social Worker/Human Services Professional IV at $76,788 (HB727_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt), and a 1.0 FTE Social Services Assistant V at $45,216 (HB727_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt). [2] The Judiciary is authorized to establish an unspecified number of temporary positions. [4] The third circuit of the judiciary shall submit a report with its findings and resource requirements to the legislature prior to the regular session of 2026. [3] This Act shall be repealed on June 30, 2028. [3] The effective date has been changed to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [4]
operating_revenue_impact: The legislative documents do not specify any anticipated impacts on operating revenues. [3] The program is funded by appropriations out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii. [3] There is no mention of the pilot program generating its own revenue. [3]
Full_Time_Equivalent_Positions: The bill establishes an unspecified number of temporary positions in the Judiciary, including full-time equivalent social worker V positions, social worker IV positions, circuit court clerk II positions, and judicial clerk positions. [3] [3] The bill also appropriates funds for temporary positions in the department of health, including a clinical psychologist, social worker/human services professional IV, and social services assistant V. [3] A committee report recommends considering $145,000 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) for one full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) temporary clinical psychologist position, $76,788 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) for one full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) temporary social worker/human services professional IV position, and $45,216 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) for one full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) temporary social services assistant V position. [4]
capital_expenditure_impact: There is appropriated an unspecified sum for fiscal year 2025-2026 and for fiscal year 2026-2027 for equipment for the women's court pilot program. [3] The provided documents do not offer a breakdown or detailed estimate for these equipment costs. [3] No other capital expenditures are outlined in the bill. [3]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: This Act shall be repealed on June 30, 2028. [3] The judiciary is required to submit a report with recommendations as to whether the women's court pilot program should continue as a pilot program, expand, provide additional services, or be discontinued. [3] Any fiscal obligations beyond the sunset date of the program would be dependent on future legislation. [3]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The updated bill, HB727 H.D. 1, significantly changes the scope of the pilot program. [4] The pilot program is now established only in the second and fifth circuits, while the third circuit is required to conduct an interim study instead of hosting a pilot program. [3] The new version adds an appropriation for the Department of Health, with a committee report requesting a specific amount of $801,802 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) and detailing costs for three 1.0 FTE positions. [4] [4] The number of temporary positions for the Judiciary has been changed from seven to an unspecified amount. [4]
